clinical_study.brief_title: Live@Home.Path: Innovating the Clinical Pathway for Home Dwelling Persons With Dementia and Their Families
clinical_study.official_title: LIVE@Home.Path: a Mixed Method, Stepped Wedge and Randomized Controlled Trial Innovating the Clinical Pathway for Home-dwelling Persons With Dementia and Their Families

collaborator.agency: Western Norway University of Applied Sciences
Norwegian National Advisory Unit on Ageing and Health

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at developing, implementing and evaluating a complex intervention involving Learning, Innovation, Volunteers and Empowerment for home dwelling persons with dementia and their caregivers. The investigators hypothesise that a successfully implemented intervention will reduce caregivers burden and be cost-effective.

detailed_description.textblock:
The provision of economically viable and proper care for the growing group of home-dwelling people with dementia (PWD) is one of the most pressing issues in our society. While a cure for dementia is not yet available, professionals and policy-makers highly prioritize the support of caregivers who experience a vast burden. However, there is a lack of high-quality research investigating clinical, social and economic factors that may add beneficial effects. This project aims to develop, test, and implement a complex intervention for PWD, intended to reduce caregivers' burden, which will aid PWD to stay safely, longer and independently at home with dignity and cost-effectiveness. The term informal caregivers' burden may include different meanings for different people and be related to economic burden, depression and anxiety, quality of life (QoL), or simply the quality of sleep and recreation. In a stepped wedge, cluster randomized controlled trial, involving primary and secondary health care systems in Bergen, Bærum and Kristiansand the 24-month LIVE@Home.Path study will be undertaken in a stepped wedge design. The user-inspired and tailored intervention includes a designated coordinator to the PWD and caregiver for 6 months to introduce a complex intervention involving a) Learning b) Innovation c) Volunteers and d) Empowerment.
Qualitative interviews will determine users' values and wishes, and promotors and barriers for successful implementation of the intervention. Primary and secondary outcomes on cognitive, emotional and social factors, cost-benefit analyses, and QoL of PWD and families will be assessed every 6-month over 2 years.
Update spring 2020: The COVID-19 pandemic severely hampered the implementation of the intervention for the second group. We therefore had to change the design, postponing the intervention in Bærum and Kristiansand, and delivering the intervention in Bergen by phone. In addition, we initiated the PAN.DEM in the LIVE@Home.Path trial, collecting data from phone interviews with caregivers on change in Health services and neuropsychiatric symptoms, risk perception and restrictions. Changes in design approved by Ethical committee (REK: 10861).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Mixed method, stepped wedge randomized controlled trial

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
primary_outcome.description: RUD:A validated tool for assessment of time use for cost effectiveness analyses, measuring total time use in hours/day for different activities, numbers of contact points with care professionals and use of medications, high time use, many contacts and many medications indicates high resource use

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 months follow up, assessment every 6 months
primary_outcome.description: RSS: measuring caregiver distress, 15 items ranging from 0-4, high score indicates high burden

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: I-ADL scale assessing instrumental activities such as use of telephone, economy, household, public transport and shopping, range from 8-31, higher score indicates poorer functioning

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: CSDD: Cornell scale for depression in dementia, range 0-38, high score indicates high symptom load

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: CMAI: Cohen-Mansfield Agitation Inventory, 29 items assessing the frequency of agitated behaviour, range 29-203, high score indicates higher severity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: NPI: presence, severity and burden of depression, anxiety, psychosis and motor disturbances, range from 0-144, high score indicates frequent, severe and burdensome symptoms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Falls, disappearances outdoor, admissions to acute wards, fire hazard

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: number of technical aids, cognitive intervention devices and assisted-living systems

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: number of participants with contact with a volunteer, number of hours spent with volunteer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: P-ADL, assessing personal activities such as toileting, grooming, dressing, transfer and eating, scale range 6-30, higher score indicates poorer personal functioning

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-5L, Descriptive measure of health related quality of life comprising 5 Dimensions With 5 Levels each, scores can be converted to a single summary index number

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D, Descriptive measure of quality of life rated on a VAS scale range 0-100, high score indicates good health

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: QoL-AD: Quality of life in Alzheimer dementia, 13 items likert scale, range from 13-52 points, high score indicates high quality of life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: number of hours spent with a volunteer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the start of intervention, and every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical global impression of change, to quantify and track patient progress and treatment response on a scale from 1 to 7, at which 7 indicates substantial worsening.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: GDS: Geriatric depression scale, 30 items rated yeas or no, high score indicates high burden

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: GMHR: General medical health rating scale, 4 point likert scale, range from 1-4, high score indicates high comorbidity burden

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assesment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: MOBID-2: assesses the intensity of pain based on interpretation of pain related behaviour, range from 0-10, high score indicates high pain intensity
IQ CODE: Proxy rater instrument for assessment of change in cognitive performance the last 10 years, range 16-80, high score indicates great decline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the intervention, and every 6 onth follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Self and proxy reported use of medications, both regular and on demand

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months follow up, assessment every 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Participation in educational programes, both for persons with dementia and for caregivers.

other_outcome.time_frame: month 6 to month 12 (during COVID-19 lock down in Norway)
other_outcome.description: Caregivers perception of risk of contamination With Sars-Cov-10

other_outcome.time_frame: month 6 to month 12 (during COVID-19 lock down in Norway)
other_outcome.description: Change in services and contact due to restrictions of COVID-19

other_outcome.time_frame: month 6 to month 12 (during COVID-19 lock down in Norway)
other_outcome.description: Caregivers perception of caregiver burden during COVID-19

other_outcome.time_frame: month 6 to month 12 (during COVID-19 lock down in Norway)
other_outcome.description: NPI: change in presence, severity and burden of depression, anxiety, psychosis and motor disturbances

other_outcome.time_frame: month 6 to month 12 (during COVID-19 lock down in Norway)
other_outcome.description: CSDD: Change in cornell scale for depression in dementia.

arm_group.description: A multicomponent intervention focusing on Learning, Innovation, Volunteers and Empowerment organized by a local coordinator.
Care coordination and facilitation as usual.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Home-dwelling people with dementia (PWD) equal or above 65 years diagnosed according to national guidelines
2. Mini mental state examination score 15-24
3. Functional Assessment Staging Test (FAST score 4-7)
4. Living with a partner, or have regular contact with a caregiver minimum 1 hour/week
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Participate in other trials
2. Expected survival under 4 weeks

patient_data.ipd_description: We plan to make individual participant data available to collaborators and researchers affiliated with the project.
